_header: Alas my child how have ye dight
Title(s): ‘A lamentacioun of our lady for sweryng’
Subjects: oaths, criticism of; Virgin Mary, complaint of, against swearers; illustrations, verse accompanying
Versification: — four-line, two-line, seven-line — abab, aa, ababbcc
_description: ‘A lamentacioun of our lady for sweryng’, with examples of typical oaths, swearers’ lamentations, and concluding moralization — 83 lines in quatrains, couplets, and rhyme royal

TCD432.First Lines:
Alas my childe how haue ye dighteYe cursed swerers all by
                    dene…
TCD432.Last Lines:
…Ordend to þe cursed be god for her hyreSeying goþe
                    cursed into euer lasting fyre
TCD432.Note:
Rubric colophon Hec que coluerunt dedisti summa tormenta. Sapiencie
                            12o (f. 66v).
TCD432.Attributed Title: A Lamentacioun of our lady for sweryng (p. 65)
TCD432.Editions:
Brotanek,  Rudolph. 
             Mittelenglische Dichtungen aus der Handschrift 432 des Trinity College
                in Dublin.
         Halle: Niemeyer, 1940: 99-102.
